alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 5:01PM MST until July 24 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 500 PM MST, Heavy rain has ended across the area. Water levels remain elevated and ongoing. Continue to use caution. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Snowflake. This includes the following highways... State Route 77 between mile markers 363 and 380. State Route 277 between mile markers 326 and 333. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Wash, Silver Creek, Concho Flat Wash, East Washboard Wash, Sevenmile Draw, Scott Wash, Washboard Wash, Phoenix Park Wash and Little Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
